column4: is there a ubuntu terminal command equivalent to OS X's Open command?
thanks however it doesn't seem to behave as expected
for instance, when i try to open an icon on my desktop lbreakout2, i type gnome-open ~/Desktop/lbreakout2 and it doesn't open; gnome-open ~/Desktop/lbreakout2.desktop opens it in gedit
or you could do a symlink to the binary, and place a custom icon and name as well on it.
it will open as you want, but it will have the arrow symbol on a corner :s
sounds like effort and produces ugly arrow :)
besides, that wouldn't exactly work with wine apps.
but aprilhare why don't you download gnome-do? its the best tool for launching applications you will ever see/have/use
trying to learn to use it now :)
